results.title: The House on the waterfall
results.brief_description: Acclaimed by the American institute of Architects as the best American building built in the last 125 years, Fallingwater, built by Frank Lloyd Wright has attracted since its construction in 1936 ongoing international accolades. The home built as a summer residence for a family was designed in direct response to it’s environment. The building is sited over a waterfall using mostly counter-levered platforms. The documentary extrapolates on the building method (with archival footage) and details with interviews the materials used and intellectual ideals that directed the external and interior functionalist aesthetics. The documentary observes the home throughout the seasons to illustrate the depth of the Lloyd Wright’s design and his consideration for a place to be lived in and shared with a changing environment. Narrated by Bingo O’Malley.

results.title: The House that dripped blood
results.creator_credit: Peter Duffell, Milton Subotsky, Max J Rosenberg, Cinerama and Amicus Productions
results.brief_description: Four short stories are linked by a police investigation into the dire circumstances in which occupants of a haunted house perish. A mystery writer inhabits the house in order to finish his latest novel, but is overtaken by the idea that his fictionalised killer really exists. In the second episode, a retired businessman becomes obsessed with a waxwork figure of a beautiful woman. Thirdly, a single father to a young girl, who keeps her mysteriously separated from society, falls victim to witchcraft. In the final episode a horror-film actor, seeking authenticity in his work, is given the cloak of a real vampire. These stories are wonderfully creepy and rely not so much on bloodshed, as on supernatural thrills and gruesome trajectories.

results.title: The Maids
results.creator_credit: Christopher Miles, Robert Enders, Cinevision Ltee and Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Adapted from French playwright, Jean Genet’s absurdist play, “The Maids” is about a pair of sisters caught up in a twisted play-acting game whereby their antipathy for their mistress and for each other, is revealed. After having her husband framed and imprisoned, the sisters, employed as maids for Madame, plan to poison her. In her temporary absence however they fantasise about dominance, wealth and power with Claire (Susannah York) acting as Madame, whilst Solange (Glenda Jackson) alternately fawns over then rants mercilessly, spitting out endless bile that speaks of her own self-loathing and hatred for her class. The film presents an impressive, and appropriate, sense of claustrophobia as the two women steer along a tragic course. Stellar cast also includes Vivien Merchant.

results.title: The Honest truth
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “What Do You Think”.
This film poses the question of whether an honest judgment is better than diplomatic double-talk in situations where an individual’s feelings may be hurt. We listen in on the conversation of high-school teen-agers following a school play in which a popular but untalented student has the leading role. The editor of the school paper defends his right to print an objective critical review of her performance. Other students feel that she should be let down more gently. The audience is invited to take over discussion of the issue.

results.title: The House of cards
results.creator_credit: Paul Seed, Ken Riddington and BBC
results.brief_description: Based on the best-selling novel by Michael Dobbs, a former aide to Margaret Thatcher, “House of cards” is a chilling political expose about the corruption of power, and the unbridled evilness of those who are determined to obtain it at all costs. Ian Richardson gives a brilliant performance as Francis Urquhart, Chief Whip and passed over by the PM in the Party allocation of “Jobs for the boys”. The PM discovers that Francis is a deadly enemy. Enlisting the aid of eager, but novice journalist Mattie Storin (Susannah Harker), Francis uses his undoubted charisma to double deal and murder his way to the top.

results.title: The House of names
results.brief_description: John Smith is convinced that changing his name will change his life. After trying out hundreds of name combinations he sets off for the registry office. But choosing a new name is only the beginning. His journey takes him to the heart of bureaucracy, and what he finds is not only a new identity but a common soul. Cast includes Kym Gyngell, Samuel Johnson, Tom Stringer, Maureen Sherlock.

results.title: The Majority vote
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “What Do You Think”.
A film designed to provoke discussion on the question of whether the elected representative of a group may legitimately support a measure which is disliked by the majority of electors. A situation is presented in which a class of high-school students voice their disapproval of the support given by their student council representative to a measure curtailing their extracurricular activities. In defending her action the representative gives adequate reasons for her support of the measure. The audience is invited to express its opinions.

results.title: One man's opinion
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “What Do You Think”.
First in a series of discussion-provoking subjects, this film shows how one person’s judgment might reasonably run counter to the majority opinion. This is illustrated in a high-school classroom where a campaign is under way to raise funds for a school project. One student, although he believes in the cause, withholds his support because he disapproves of the high-pressure methods which put individuals on the spot if they are unable to or do not wish to contribute. The audience is asked for their appraisal.

results.title: The Honeymoon
results.creator_credit: Laurel Whitcroft (Allen) and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. A family album of the holidays in the Victorian Alps taken initially by Laurel and her husband for their honeymoon, then the subsequent returns by the growing family throughout the decades.
results.description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. results.title: The Hour before my brother dies
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Daniel Keene, James Clayden and Noel Price
results.brief_description: Adapted from the stage play by Daniel Keene. Sally visits her brother Martin, the hour before he is due to be hanged for murder. What is the hold these two have on each other physically and emotionally? Cast includes Peter Hehir (Martin), Rhonda Wilson (Sally), Reg Evans (father) and Margot Duell (mother).
